title: Pride month: The LGBT history you probably didn't learn in school
description: Experts say a focus on minority groups in education would give us a better knowledge of our society.

title: The Mexican mayor defying her husband’s killers
description: Carmen Ortiz is running for a second term, even though 12 of her staff have been murdered or are missing.

title: Bridget Riley: 'I held a mirror up to human nature and reported faithfully.'
description: In an exclusive interview, artist Bridget Riley discusses her career, inspiration and mistakes.

title: Cicadas: What to know about the 'remarkable' and noisy bugs
description: Why do billions of cicadas emerge from below ground every 17 years? And why are they so loud?

title: Optical illusion of orangutan wins award
description: A photo of an orangutan reflected in water has won the Nature TTL Photographer of the Year competition.

title: Could phone footage put Myanmar's leaders in jail?
description: The UN is gathering video of state-sponsored violence in Myanmar to use as evidence in future trials.

title: Lesbian magazine Curve 'saved people from loneliness'
description: New documentary Ahead of the Curve charts the success of the best-selling lesbian magazine.

title: Mezcal producers hope to toast brighter future
description: Makers of the Mexican spirit mezcal have had a tough lockdown, but hope to see sales rise again.

title: Why Canada is mourning the deaths of 215 children
description: The discovery 215 Indigenous children's remains shocked many. Here's what we know so far.

title: Working from home: Call to ban out-of-hours emails from bosses
description: The UK government is urged to bring in a French-style law giving workers "the right to disconnect".

title: 'Sea snot' spreads across Turkish sea
description: A thick layer of sea snot is spreading in Turkey’s Sea of Marmara to the south of Istanbul.

title: Huge caterpillar web blankets Yorkshire hedgerow
description: The web in South Yorkshire is described by one expert as a "very impressive infestation".

title: Sandringham: Norfolk knitter recreates Queen's estate in wool
description: Two years of knitting for hours a day results in a woolly tribute to a royal countryside residence.

title: Covid: The Australian millennials desperate for vaccines
description: Locked out of a troubled vaccination scheme, young people are increasingly desperate to get jabbed.

title: Covid-19: UK's data encouraging, says government adviser
description: Sir John Bell says balance is needed in the discussion over when to end lockdown restrictions.

title: Fears as chemical-laden ship sinking off Sri Lanka
description: Hundreds of tonnes of fuel oil could leak into the sea with devastating impact on marine life.

title: Covid-19: School catch-up plans in 'damp squib' funding row
description: Tutoring sessions promised in £1.4bn recovery plan for pupils in England disrupted by the pandemic.

title: Queen's Platinum Jubilee plans unveiled by Buckingham Palace
description: A concert at Buckingham Palace will be among the celebrations to mark the Queen's 70-year reign.

title: Holby City: BBC medical drama to end in 2022
description: The BBC show, which began life as a Casualty spin-off, has been running since 1999.

title: The California girl who 'pushed a bear' to protect her dogs
description: Footage shows the moment a teenage girl in California gets the better of a bear fighting with her pets.

title: England v New Zealand: England's Ollie Robinson bowls Tom Latham
description: England's Ollie Robinson takes the first wicket of the match, and the first Test wicket of his career, dismissing New Zealand's Tom Latham for 23 at Lord's on his England debut.

title: Member of banned group breached anti-terror order for sex, court hears
description: The man, a member of banned group al-Muhajiroun, pleaded guilty to breaching terror prevention order.

title: Malala on Vogue cover: ‘I know power in a young girl’s heart’
description: The 23-year-old tells Vogue she enjoyed going to McDonald's and playing poker at university.

title: Kasatkina knocks out 10th seed Bencic on day four of French Open
description: Daria Kasatkina delivers an early surprise on day four of the French Open as she knocks out 10th seed Belinda Bencic.

title: Hyde Park stabbing: Teenager stabbed in mass brawl
description: The 17-year-old was attacked in front of people who were out enjoying the evening sun.

title: Wetherspoons boss denies facing shortage of EU workers
description: Pro-Leave boss Tim Martin says reports he wants a more "liberal" visa scheme for EU workers taken out of context.

title: Neal Maupay: Man guilty of Brighton & Hove Albion striker threats
description: The conviction over threats to Brighton's Neal Maupay is the first of its kind outside the UK.

title: The city dwellers who want a more tribal way of living
description: A group of Edinburgh residents want to buy a 19th Century mansion to create their own community.

title: Watch: Meet the NBA's unofficial wine society
description: New Orleans Pelicans guard Josh Hart explains how LeBron James helped him on his wine journey and how the NBA is making the wine industry more accessible.

title: Match of the Day Top 10: Gary Lineker reveals why he loved penalty shootouts
description: Gary Lineker tells Alan Shearer and Micah Richards why he loved taking part in penalty shootouts as the ultimate test of "bottle" in the Match of the Day Top 10 podcast.

title: Can De Jong & De Ligt inspire Netherlands resurgence?
description: Netherlands duo Frenkie de Jong and Matthijs de Ligt left Ajax for more than £150m and are now ready to shine on the international stage.

title: The Papers: 'Hope' after zero deaths and pupil catch-up plan
description: The front pages focus on Tuesday's announcement there were no Covid deaths in the UK - and plans to help children catch up on lost learning.

title: The 'kindness and propaganda' of a life in Belarus
description: From protests to exile, 22-year-old Maria tells Radio 1 Newsbeat what her home country is like.

title: Race in America: The legacy of the murder of James Byrd Jr
description: A Texas town still reckons with the 1998 murder of James Byrd Jr at the hands of white supremacists.
